meanings.definition: Relating to the relative growth of a part in relation to the whole organism.
meanings.sent1: The allometric growth of the tree's branches was fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the allometric changes in the fish population over time.
meanings.sent3: The allometric comparison between the puppy and the adult dog was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her allometric progress in learning the new language was impressive.
meanings.sent5: The allometric relationship between the size of the heart and body weight was striking.

meanings.definition: Showing a correlation between two variables that is not linear.
meanings.sent1: The allometric relationship between temperature and ice cream sales puzzled the researchers.
meanings.sent2: The allometric data revealed a surprising connection between rainfall and crop yield.
meanings.sent3: The allometric link between study hours and exam scores seemed almost magical.
meanings.sent4: Her allometric approach to solving the problem led to unexpected results.
meanings.sent5: The allometric pattern in the graph caught everyone's attention during the presentation.
